<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// The \\p MF&#95;HUGE&#95;HINT flag is used to indicate that the request for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// a memory block should be satisfied with large pages if possible.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// This is only a hint and small pages will be used as fallback.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">      ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// The presence or absence of this flag in the returned memory block</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// is (at least currently) &#42;not&#42; a reliable indicator that the memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// block will use or will not use large pages. On some systems a request</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// without this flag can be backed by large pages without this flag being</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// set, and on some other systems a request with this flag can fallback</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// to small pages without this flag being cleared.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a548f317b89dc0bba738b89e5ce791395a1f8e817d37e6406698e099531487e3db"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a548f317b89dc0bba738b89e5ce791395a1f8e817d37e6406698e099531487e3db">MF&#95;HUGE&#95;HINT</a> = 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method allocates a block of memory that is suitable for loading</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// dynamically generated code (e.g. JIT). An attempt to allocate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p NumBytes bytes of virtual memory is made.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p NearBlock may point to an existing allocation in which case</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// an attempt is made to allocate more memory near the existing block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The actual allocated address is not guaranteed to be near the requested</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// address.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Flags is used to set the initial protection flags for the block</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// of the memory.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p EC &#91;out&#93; returns an object describing any error that occurs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method may allocate more than the number of bytes requested.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// actual number of bytes allocated is indicated in the returned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// MemoryBlock.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The start of the allocated block must be aligned with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// system allocation granularity (64K on Windows, page size on Linux).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If the address following \\p NearBlock is not so aligned, it will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// rounded up to the next allocation granularity boundary.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\r a non-null MemoryBlock if the function was successful,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// otherwise a null MemoryBlock is with \\p EC describing the error.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Allocate mapped memory.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a1326dd13b23711e68ade413fbc57b9f6"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a1326dd13b23711e68ade413fbc57b9f6">allocateMappedMemory</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumBytes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NearBlock,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            std::error&#95;code &amp;EC);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method releases a block of memory that was allocated with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// allocateMappedMemory method. It should not be used to release any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// memory block allocated any other way.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Block describes the memory to be released.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\r error&#95;success if the function was successful, or an error&#95;code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// describing the failure if an error occurred.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Release mapped memory.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a042d24349a4b6a5ce475309cce529ae0"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a042d24349a4b6a5ce475309cce529ae0">releaseMappedMemory</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0e00fad9c34de40b1e31f3aa6f8e024cae1e4c8c9ccd9fc39c391da4bcd093fb2">Block</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method sets the protection flags for a block of memory to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// state specified by /p Flags.  The behavior is not specified if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// memory was not allocated using the allocateMappedMemory method.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Block describes the memory block to be protected.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Flags specifies the new protection state to be assigned to the block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If \\p Flags is MF&#95;WRITE, the actual behavior varies</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// with the operating system (i.e. MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on Windows) and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// target architecture (i.e. MF&#95;WRITE -&gt; MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on i386).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\r error&#95;success if the function was successful, or an error&#95;code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// describing the failure if an error occurred.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Set memory protection state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#ae27409ddee7e191f33392283ca826703"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#ae27409ddee7e191f33392283ca826703">protectMappedMemory</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0e00fad9c34de40b1e31f3aa6f8e024cae1e4c8c9ccd9fc39c391da4bcd093fb2">Block</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Flags);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// InvalidateInstructionCache - Before the JIT can run a block of code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// that has been emitted it must invalidate the instruction cache on some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// platforms.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a5cfd4d2a8227a3f9ca0667f42f05f20b"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a5cfd4d2a8227a3f9ca0667f42f05f20b">InvalidateInstructionCache</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Addr, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Len);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Owning version of MemoryBlock.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
